definition.name: Changelog Updater
definition.description: Automatically update a CHANGELOG with the latest release notes.
definition.author: Stefan Zweifel <stefan@stefanzweifel.dev>

inputs.name: release-notes
inputs.description: The release notes you want to add to your CHANGELOG. Should be markdown. If not provided, the content between the Unreleased heading and the previous release heading is taken as release notes.

inputs.name: latest-version
inputs.description: Semantic version number of the latest release. The value will be used as a heading text.

inputs.name: release-date
inputs.description: The date the latest version has been released. Defaults to the current date.

inputs.name: path-to-changelog
inputs.description: Defaults to `CHANGELOG.md`. Path to CHANGELOG.md file.

inputs.name: compare-url-target-revision
inputs.description: Target revision used in compare URL inside a possible "Unreleased" heading.

inputs.name: heading-text
inputs.description: Text used in the new release heading. Defaults to the value from latest-version.

inputs.name: hide-release-date
inputs.description: Hide release date in the new release heading.

inputs.name: parse-github-usernames
inputs.description: Experimental: Find GitHub usernames in release notes and link to their profile.

outputs.name: release_compare_url
outputs.description: The generated compare URL for the just created relase. For example https://github.com/org/repo/compare/v1.0.0...v1.1.0

outputs.name: release_url_fragment
outputs.description: The URL fragment for the just created release. For example '#v100---2021-02-01'. You can use this to generate URLs that point to the newly created release in your CHANGELOG.

outputs.name: unreleased_compare_url
outputs.description: The generated compare URL between the latest version and the target revision. For example https://github.com/org/repo/compare/v1.0.0...HEAD

evidence.reasoning: The Changelog Updater action focuses on automatically updating the CHANGELOG, which is a documentation task. It also contributes to code quality by ensuring that release notes are consistently maintained and published.
